label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns, dye Technique: Tied resist patterning on plain weave

label: Description
value: Cotton textile created in the double ikat  or 'geringsing' technique showing a "kota-mesir" pattern (four-pointed star, notched internal pattern, divides piece into semi-circular segments). Semi-circles depict "wayang patlikur isi" motif (geometric wayang figure) and other figures. Wide border at end with geometric pattern. Design in tan on black. Fringed.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: tied resist patterning in warp and weft (double ikat) on plain weave Label: cotton with tied resist patterning in warp and weft (double ikat)

label: Description
value: Red silk square brocaded in an allover pattern of stylized leaves in yellow and dark green. Stripe in the borders.

label: Description
value: Narrow textile, probably a breast cloth (kemben), with ikat warp-printed center. In black, red, and white. Ends brocaded and warps gathered in tin edging.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, tin edging Technique: tied resist patterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave; discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 167.6 x 36.8 cm (66 x 14 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Panel woven entirely with gold threads and additional colors of red, purple and green showing an allover geometric tree pattern. Border, parallel to selvage, has flowers. Both ends of the panel setoff by a wide border showing floral groups. Gold fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk Technique: compound weave Label: silk and metallic thread in compound weave

label: Description
value: Man's coat, resist-dyed and block printed in red and black on cream ground in all-over border patterns. The collar, cuffs and hem are decorated with multi-colored silk embroidery with mirrors in floral and geometric motifs.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton foundation, silk embroidery, mirrors Technique: plain weave, resist and block printed, embroidered

label: Description
value: Two small panels showing a floral motif surrounded by a floral border in coral, green and light blue on a light brown ground. Floral motifs rise from a footed flat dish.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft (?)

label: Description
value: Long and narrow textile, probably a breast cloth (kemben), in red with green, purple, orange, and yellow. Borders fringed and heavily brocaded. Center design shows diamond-shaped lattice pattern with brocaded geometric florals.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: tied resist patterning in weft (ikat) on plain weave; discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Long silk textile, probably a shoulder cloth (selendang), in dark brown against red. Plaid ground with all-over brocading of geometric pattern with center motif on main ground. Heavy brocading in borders.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic threads Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Red silk brocaded cloth (kain songket) with all-over geometric pattern of stars and rosettes in gold brocade, with wide panel at one end showing the "tumpal" motif (row of isosceles triangles). Geometric border in gold.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic threads Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Textile, probably a sarong, of dark red ground with blue plaid all-over design showing small pattern of metallic embroidery. Wide border shows geometric lattice design.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic threads Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Complete sarong with two heavily brocaded ends showing the tumpal motif, triangles, and a small allover pattern of stars and rosettes. Central section of weft ikat predominantly in shades of red. Side borders have metal thread brocading.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: weft ikat with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Length of brocaded with with large bouquets of pale pink roses with green foliage on an ivory ground.

label: Description
value: Panel of light blue and white silk with light red details. Pattern shows large scale, symmetrical repeat; fan-shaped with large leaves and branching bands. Both selvages present. Repeat 0M660 long.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 7&1 satin (blue) patterned by floats of weft from every second shed (white) bound by a supplementary warp (white) in plain weave and by floats of complementary wefts in every second shed (white and red) bound on the front as 1/3 twill

label: Credit line
value: Museum Purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

label: Description
value: The design was assembled from contemporary prints depicting two separate balloon flights from Paris in 1783. One balloon landed in the village of Gonesse; frightened villagers mistook the ballon for a monster and called for an exorcism. The second flight, the first to carry human passengers (Nicolas Robert and Jacquest Charles), landed on the Nesles plain 22 miles from Paris, where it was met by a delegation of citizens. Printed in red on white cotton, seamed in the center; both selvedges present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave

value: Warp x Weft: 134.6 x 91.4 cm (53 x 36 in.) Repeat H: 100.3 cm (39 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The bust is shown turned half-left. Signed (in charcoal) lower right: "P. Montana / April 1910".

value: Charcoal on white paper. Wm.: Michallet/ Framce
Head of a Roman matron (rendering from a plaster cast)

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The head is seen turned slightly to the left, and rests on a socle. Signed (in charcoal), lower right: "P. Montana / Mar. 1910".
Standing male nude seen from the back

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The model restes his left hand on a staff, the upper part of which is not visible. Inscribed (in charcoal), upper right: "4 hours" and signed, lower right: "P. Montana".

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. A nude woman, turned half-right is shown in the act of leaping, her arms raised over her head. Signed (in charcoal): "P. Montana".

label: Physical description
value: Charcoal and white heightening on grey paper
Half figure of a seated nude woman

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The figure is seen from the back, turned towad the right, her hands in the gesture of arranging her hair. Signed (in pencil), lower right: "Montana" and again (in red chalk), lower left: "P.M."

label: Physical description
value: Red, black and white chalks on pale grey paper.
Recto: Caricature sketches; verso: standing nude female

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Recto: Five caricature sketches of male heads; probably classmates and the instructure of the artist. Self- portrait, lower left. Verso: standing female nude studio model seen from the back.

label: Description
value: Weaver's thesis book or manuscript of 200 patterns on 157 leaves executed in pen and ink. Patterns for weaving and embroidery with inscriptions. Geometric, floral, and animal designs.

Untitled Montage of Figures in Landscapes

label: Description
value: Montage scene that shows many people, predominately women and children, in various activities within a broad landscape that includes a Gothic ruin, the Rhine Valley and the Capitol at Washington.

value: Notebook of a student's study of the theory of weaving and pattern making at Lyon and contains weave drafts, loom threadings, and fabric samples.
